sen.j: 副将軍（ふくしょうぐん）は、日本においては大将軍或いは将軍の次席に位する武官の職である。
sen.e: Vice shogun is the post of military officer which was ranked the next position of "Dai Shogun (the great general)" or shogun in Japan.
Vice shogun is the post of military officer which was ranked the next position of "Dai Shogun (the great general)" or shogun in Japan.
Vice shogun is the post of military officer which was ranked the next position of "Dai Shogun (the great general)" or shogun in Japan.

sen.j: 律令制では大将軍、将軍、副将軍という序列が規定されたが、実際には大将軍に対しても将軍を中抜きして副将軍がつけられた。
sen.e: Under the Ritsuryo system, ranking in the order Dai Shogun, shogun, vice shogun was stipulated, however, in fact, vice shogun was directly placed to Dai shogun, eliminating shogun.
Under the Ritsuryo system, ranking in order of Dai Shogun, shogun, vice shogun was stipulated, however, in fact, vice shogun was directly placed to Dai shogun, eliminating shogun.
sen.cmt: ranking in order →ranking in order of
sen.e: Under the Ritsuryo system, ranking in order of Dai Shogun, shogun, vice shogun was stipulated, however, in fact, vice shogun was directly placed to Dai shogun, eliminating shogun.

sen.j: さらに副官としての権副将軍という官職もあった。
sen.e: Moreover, there was government post as adjutant, a vice-Fukushogun (Vice-Shogun).
Moreover, there was government post as adjutant, a vice-Fukushogun (Vice-Shogun).
Moreover, there was government post as adjutant, a vice-Fukushogun (Vice-Shogun).

sen.j: 律令制下の副将軍
sen.e: Vice shogun under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the restudy code)
Vice shogun under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code)
Vice shogun under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code)

sen.j: 日本の律令制では、軍防令24条に副将軍の規定がある。
sen.e: Under the Ritsuryo system in Japan, there was stipulations concerning vice shogun in Article 24 of Gunboryo (the Statute on Military Defense).
Under the Ritsuryo system in Japan, there was stipulations concerning vice shogun in Article 24 of Gunboryo (the Statute on Military Defense).
Under the Ritsuryo system in Japan, there was stipulations concerning vice shogun in Article 24 of Gunboryo (the Statute on Military Defense).

sen.j: それによれば、将帥が出征するとき兵一万人以上なら将軍一人、副将軍二人を置く。
sen.e: According to this, when a commander went to fight, if the number of soldiers was more than 10,000, one shogun and two vice shogun were supposed to be placed.
According to this, when a commander went to fight, if the number of soldiers was more than 10,000, one shogun and two vice shogun were supposed to be placed.
According to this, when a commander went to fight, if the number of soldiers was more than 10,000, one shogun and two vice shogun were supposed to be placed.

sen.j: また、三軍ごとに大将軍一人を置く。
sen.e: And, Dai shogun was placed in every three troops.
And, Dai shogun was placed in every three troops.
And, Dai shogun was placed in every three troops.

sen.j: しかし実際の任命はこの規定通りではなく、任命された副将軍は一人から数人の幅があった。
sen.e: In fact, against the stipulations, one to a few vice shogun were appointed.
In fact, against the stipulations, one to a few vice shogun were appointed.
In fact, against the stipulations, one to a few vice shogun were appointed.

sen.j: また、大将軍の下に将軍がつけられることはなく、直接に副将軍がつけられた。
sen.e: And, shogun was never placed under Dai shogun but vice shogun was directly placed under Dai shogun.
And, shogun was never placed under Dai shogun but vice shogun was directly placed under Dai shogun.
And, shogun was never placed under Dai shogun but vice shogun was directly placed under Dai shogun.

sen.j: 史書には「副使」（使≒将軍）とも記される。
sen.e: In the history book, vice shogun is also written as '副使'(使≒将軍) "Vice Commander."
In the history book, vice shogun is also written as "Vice Commander" (the Chinese character of commander used in the book had almost the same meaning as shogun).
sen.cmt: 副使（使≒将軍）→ (the chinese character of commander used in the book had almost the same meaning as shogun).に変更。
sen.e: In the history book, vice shogun is also written as "Vice Commander" (the Chinese character of commander used in the book had almost the same meaning as shogun).

sen.j: 例としては、延暦3年（784年）2月に大伴弟麻呂が征東副将軍に任ぜられている。
sen.e: For example, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed as Seito vice shogun in February, 784.
For example, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed as Seito vice shogun in February, 784.
For example, OTOMO no Otomaro was appointed as Seito vice shogun in February, 784.

sen.j: この副将軍人事は、征東軍の総司令官たる将軍人事よりも前に行われており、副将軍人事の翌年に大伴家持が持節征東将軍に任ぜられ、蝦夷討伐の軍を発している。
sen.e: This appointment of vice shogun was done before the appointment of shogun, a commander in chief of the army to subdue the eastern barbarians, and next year of the appointment of vice shogun, OTOMO no Yakamochi was appointed as Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians) and sent punitive force of Ezo.

This appointment of vice shogun was done before the appointment of shogun, a commander in chief of the army to subdue the eastern barbarians, and next year of the appointment of vice shogun, OTOMO no Yakamochi was appointed as Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians) and sent punitive force of Ezo.

This appointment of vice shogun was done before the appointment of shogun, a commander in chief of the army to subdue the eastern barbarians, and next year of the appointment of vice shogun, OTOMO no Yakamochi was appointed as Jisetsu Seito Shogun (the general of conquering east-barbarians) and sent punitive force of Ezo.

sen.j: さらに延暦13年（794年）1月1日、朝廷が奥羽の蝦夷を征伐するために派遣した征夷大将軍大伴弟麻呂の副官として坂上田村麻呂を征夷副将軍に任じたのが有名である。
sen.e: In addition, it is well known that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro was appointed as Seii fukushogun on February 9 794 as the adjutant for OTOMO no Otomaro, Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") who was dispatched to conquer Ezo in Ou by the Imperial Court.

In addition, it is well known that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro was appointed as Seii vice shogun on February 5, 794 as the adjutant for OTOMO no Otomaro, Seii taishogun (Seii great shogun, literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") who was dispatched to conquer Ezo in Ou by the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: February 9 → February 5用語共有では征夷大将軍と征夷副将軍は Seii taishogun, Seii fukushogun になっていますが、この章の他の副将軍の表記をあわせるために seii great shogun, seii vice shogunと表記しました。
sen.e: In addition, it is well known that SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro was appointed as Seii vice shogun on February 5, 794 as the adjutant for OTOMO no Otomaro, Seii taishogun (Seii great shogun, literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") who was dispatched to conquer Ezo in Ou by the Imperial Court.

sen.j: さらに、副将軍の下位には権副将軍も置かれた。
sen.e: Vice-Fukushogun was placed under vice shogun.
Vice-Fukushogun was placed under vice shogun.
Vice-Fukushogun was placed under vice shogun.

sen.j: その後、弘仁2年（811年）に文屋綿麻呂が征夷将軍に任ぜられると、大伴今人・佐伯耳麻呂・坂上鷹養の3名が副将軍を拝命している。
sen.e: Then, in 811, after FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed as seii shogun (great general who subdues the barbarians), OTOMO no Imando, SAEKI no Mimimaro and SAKANOUE no Takakai received an official appointment as vice shogun.

Then, in 811, after FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed as seii shogun (great general who subdues the barbarians), OTOMO no Imando, SAEKI no Mimimaro and SAKANOUE no Takakai received an official appointment as vice shogun.

Then, in 811, after FUNYA no Watamaro was appointed as seii shogun (great general who subdues the barbarians), OTOMO no Imando, SAEKI no Mimimaro and SAKANOUE no Takakai received an official appointment as vice shogun.

sen.j: 弘仁6年（815年）にはさらに征東副将軍陸奥介に小野氷見が任ぜられており、たびたび奥羽の蝦夷征伐の人事がなされた。
sen.e: In 815, ONO no Himi was appointed as seito vice shogun Mutsu no suke (assistant governor of Mutsu Province), and the appointment for the sake of conquest of Ezo in Ou was done several times.

In 815, ONO no Himi was appointed as seito vice shogun Mutsu no suke (vice shogun who subdues the eastern barbarians, and assistant governor of Mutsu Province); like this, appointments of vice shogun for the sake of conquest of Ezo in Ou were done several times.
sen.cmt: vice shogun who subdues the eastern barbarians, and を追加and the appointment for …was →; like this appointments of vice shogun for … wereに変更
sen.e: In 815, ONO no Himi was appointed as seito vice shogun Mutsu no suke (vice shogun who subdues the eastern barbarians, and assistant governor of Mutsu Province); like this, appointments of vice shogun for the sake of conquest of Ezo in Ou were done several times.

sen.j: 蝦夷征伐が一応の区切りを見せて、将軍・大将軍の任命がなされなくなったのに伴い、副将軍の任命も稀になった。
sen.e: With an end of conquest of ezo and appointment of shogun and Daishogun, appointment of vice shogun had became rare.
With an end of conquest of ezo and appointment of shogun and Daishogun, appointment of vice shogun had became rare.
With an end of conquest of ezo and appointment of shogun and Daishogun, appointment of vice shogun had became rare.

sen.j: 平安時代中期では、承平天慶の乱の最中の天慶3年(940年)2月8日に源経基が征夷副将軍に任ぜられたとする記録がある。
sen.e: In mid Heian period, there is written record that MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto was appointed as Seii fukushogun during the Johei and Tengyo War on March 24, 940.
In mid Heian period, there is a written record that MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto was appointed as Seii vice shogun during the Johei and Tengyo War on March 19, 940.
sen.cmt: written record → a written recordMarch 24 → March 19fukushogun → vice shogun
sen.e: In mid Heian period, there is a written record that MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto was appointed as Seii vice shogun during the Johei and Tengyo War on March 19, 940.

sen.j: 源頼朝が征夷大将軍となり鎌倉幕府を開き、武家政権が成立するようになった後も、副将軍を任ずる人事はほとんどなされることはなく、鎌倉時代には一度も副将軍が任ぜられる例はなかった。
sen.e: After MINAMOTO no Yoritomo became seii taishogun and established Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and formed military government, there was almost no one who was appointed as vice shogun and in Kamakura period there was no one who was appointed as vice shogun.

After MINAMOTO no Yoritomo became seii taishogun and established Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and formed military government, there was almost no one who was appointed as vice shogun and in Kamakura period there was no one who was appointed as vice shogun.

After MINAMOTO no Yoritomo became seii taishogun and established Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and formed military government, there was almost no one who was appointed as vice shogun and in Kamakura period there was no one who was appointed as vice shogun.

sen.j: 室町幕府における副将軍
sen.e: Vice shogun in Muromachi period
Vice shogun in Muromachi period
Vice shogun in Muromachi period

sen.j: 室町時代においても副将軍は常設ではなかったが、何度か任命された例はある。
sen.e: In Muromachi period, vice shogun was not permanent, but appointed once or twice.
In Muromachi period, vice shogun was not permanent, but appointed once or twice.
In Muromachi period, vice shogun was not permanent, but appointed once or twice.

sen.j: 初期の建武 (日本)5年（1338年）、足利尊氏の弟足利直義が征夷副将軍に任ぜられている。
sen.e: In 1338, the early Muromachi period, Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, younger brother of Takauji ASHIKAGA was appointed as Seii fukushogun.
In 1338, the early Muromachi period, Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, younger brother of Takauji ASHIKAGA was appointed as Seii fukushogun.
In 1338, the early Muromachi period, Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, younger brother of Takauji ASHIKAGA was appointed as Seii fukushogun.

sen.j: また、上杉禅秀の乱の鎮圧に功績があった今川範政が副将軍に任ぜられたとする記録が残されている。
sen.e: And also, there is a written record that Norimasa IMAGAWA, who played a role in quelling War of Zenshu UESUGI, was appointed as vice shogun.
And also, there is a written record that Norimasa IMAGAWA, who played a role in quelling War of Zenshu UESUGI, was appointed as vice shogun.
And also, there is a written record that Norimasa IMAGAWA, who played a role in quelling War of Zenshu UESUGI, was appointed as vice shogun.

sen.j: 室町後期の関東にあっては古河公方足利氏が関東武士の間において権威を誇っていたが、同氏の出身である足利義明は古河公方足利高基・足利晴氏父子に対抗し、小弓公方を自称した。
sen.e: In the late Muromachi period, Koga Kubo Ashikaga Clan boasted authority over Kanto Samurai in Kanto region, and Yoshiaki Ashikaga from the same clan proclaimed himself Oyumi-kubo against Takamoto ASHIKAGA and Haruuji ASHIKAGA, father and son.

In the late Muromachi period, Koga kubo Ashikaga Clan boasted authority over Kanto Samurai in Kanto region, then Yoshiaki Ashikaga from the same clan proclaimed himself Oyumi kubo in rivalry with Koga kubo's father and son, Takamoto ASHIKAGA and Haruuji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 公方の表記を kuboに統一また、原文の意味に沿って後半を修正しました。
sen.e: In the late Muromachi period, Koga kubo Ashikaga Clan boasted authority over Kanto Samurai in Kanto region, then Yoshiaki Ashikaga from the same clan proclaimed himself Oyumi kubo in rivalry with Koga kubo's father and son, Takamoto ASHIKAGA and Haruuji ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: このとき、安房の戦国大名里見氏は義明を奉じて関東副将軍を自称したとされる。
sen.e: At this time, Satomi clan, daimyo in the Sengoku period proclaimed himself as Kanto vice shogun, following Yoshiaki.
At this time, Satomi clan, daimyo in the Sengoku period proclaimed himself as Kanto vice shogun, following Yoshiaki.
At this time, Satomi clan, daimyo in the Sengoku period proclaimed himself as Kanto vice shogun, following Yoshiaki.

sen.j: 足利義昭による任命例
sen.e: Appointment by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA
Appointment by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA
Appointment by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）7月、15代将軍足利義昭が自らの将軍職就任に功のあった織田信長に対して副将軍か管領職への就任を要請したという記録が残されている。
sen.e: On August 4, 1568, there is a written record that the fifteenth shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA asked Nobunaga ODA, who performed a great deeds for Yoshiaki's assumption of the post of shogun, to serve as vice shogun or administrative post.

On August, 1568, there is a written record that the fifteenth shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA asked Nobunaga ODA, who performed great deeds for Yoshiaki's assumption of the post of shogun, to serve as vice shogun or administrative post.
sen.cmt: 原文が月までの表記なので日にちを削除 August 4 →Augusta great deeds → great deeds
sen.e: On August, 1568, there is a written record that the fifteenth shogun Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA asked Nobunaga ODA, who performed great deeds for Yoshiaki's assumption of the post of shogun, to serve as vice shogun or administrative post.

sen.j: しかし、信長はこれを辞退したとされる。
sen.e: However, it is said that Nobunaga declined this offer.
However, it is said that Nobunaga declined this offer.
However, it is said that Nobunaga declined this offer.

sen.j: その後、義昭と信長が対立すると、義昭は信長の同盟者である徳川家康を味方に取り込むために副将軍への就任を要請したが、家康は応じなかったとされる。
sen.e: After Yoshiaki and Nobunaga were opposed to each other, Yoshiaki asked Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, an ally of Nobunaga, to become the vice shogun in order to win him to Yoshiaki's side, but it is said that Ieyasu declined this offer.

After Yoshiaki and Nobunaga were opposed to each other, Yoshiaki asked Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, an ally of Nobunaga, to become the vice shogun in order to win him to Yoshiaki's side, but it is said that Ieyasu declined this offer.

After Yoshiaki and Nobunaga were opposed to each other, Yoshiaki asked Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, an ally of Nobunaga, to become the vice shogun in order to win him to Yoshiaki's side, but it is said that Ieyasu declined this offer.

sen.j: 義昭が信長によって京都を追放され、備後国の鞆にて毛利氏の庇護に入ると、義昭は毛利輝元を副将軍に任じ、鞆において幕府の再建を目指した。
sen.e: After Yoshiaki was expelled from Kyoto by Nobunaga and came under the patronage of Mori clan in Tomo, Bingo Province, he appointed Terumoto Mori as vice shogun and tried to re-establish Muromachi Bakufu in Tomo.

After Yoshiaki was expelled from Kyoto by Nobunaga and came under the patronage of Mori clan in Tomo, Bingo Province, he appointed Terumoto Mori as vice shogun and tried to re-establish Muromachi bakufu in Tomo.
sen.cmt: Muromachi Bakufu →Muromachi bakufu (前述の鎌倉幕府にあわせました）
sen.e: After Yoshiaki was expelled from Kyoto by Nobunaga and came under the patronage of Mori clan in Tomo, Bingo Province, he appointed Terumoto Mori as vice shogun and tried to re-establish Muromachi bakufu in Tomo.

sen.j: しかし、信長は明智光秀の謀叛に倒れるものの、天下は豊臣秀吉の手に移り、幕府の再興はならなかった。
sen.e: Although Nobunaga was killed by rebellion of Mitsuhide AKECHI, ruling power was shifted to the hand of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and Yoshiaki was not able to re-establish Muromachi Bakufu.
Although Nobunaga was killed by rebellion of Mitsuhide AKECHI, the ruling power was shifted to the hand of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and Yoshiaki was not able to re-establish Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: ruling power →the ruling powerMuromachi Bakufu →Muromachi bakufu (前述の鎌倉幕府にあわせました）
sen.e: Although Nobunaga was killed by rebellion of Mitsuhide AKECHI, the ruling power was shifted to the hand of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and Yoshiaki was not able to re-establish Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 江戸時代における副将軍
sen.e: Vice shogun in Edo period
Vice shogun in Edo period
Vice shogun in Edo period

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の死後、関ヶ原の戦いに勝利した徳川家康が征夷大将軍に任ぜられ、江戸幕府が開かれたが、幕府内に「副将軍」という役職はなく、江戸時代において副将軍が任ぜられることは一度もなかった。
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who won The Battle of Sekigahara was appointed as seii taishogun and established Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who won The Battle of Sekigahara was appointed as seii taishogun and established Edo bakufu, however, the post "vice shogun" was not placed, therefore, no one was appointed as vice shogun in Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処の必要はないように思われますので、分かれていたものをまとめました。
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who won The Battle of Sekigahara was appointed as seii taishogun and established Edo bakufu, however, the post "vice shogun" was not placed, therefore, no one was appointed as vice shogun in Edo period.

sen.j: しかし、徳川御三家の一角である水戸藩主は天下の副将軍或いは水戸の副将軍と称されることが多い。
sen.e: However, the lord of the Mito Domain, one of the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) is often called as a vice shogun in the world or vice shogun in Mito.
However, the lord of the Mito Domain, one of the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) is often called as a vice shogun in the world or vice shogun in Mito.
However, the lord of the Mito Domain, one of the Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) is often called as a vice shogun in the world or vice shogun in Mito.

sen.j: これは、水戸藩主の地位が他の大名と違って、参勤交代せずに常に江戸に留まる定府が義務付けられていたこと、将軍の補佐役としての色彩が強かった。
sen.e: Status of the lord of Mito Domain was different from other daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), and they were required to Jofu (a Daimyo feudal lord's retainer who remained permanently in the Edo with the lord's and their own family in the Edo period) in stead of Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and they were more likely to be the assistant for shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Status of the lord of Mito Domain was different from other daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), and they were required to Jofu (a Daimyo feudal lord's retainer who remained permanently in the Edo with the lord's and their own family in the Edo period) in stead of Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and they were more likely to be the assistant for shogun.

Status of the lord of Mito Domain was different from other daimyo (Japanese feudal lords), and they were required to Jofu (a Daimyo feudal lord's retainer who remained permanently in the Edo with the lord's and their own family in the Edo period) in stead of Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and they were more likely to be the assistant for shogun.

sen.j: ことなどから、そのように呼ばれるようになったとされる。
sen.e: For these reasons, it is said that the lord of Mito Domain became to be called the vice shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For these reasons, it is said that the lord of Mito Domain became to be called the vice shogun.
For these reasons, it is said that the lord of Mito Domain became to be called the vice shogun.

sen.j: 正式な呼称ではなく、上記のような事実から付いた俗称である。
sen.e: This is not an official but familiar name, that was named by the fact written above.
This is not an official but familiar name, that was named by the fact written above.
This is not an official but familiar name, that was named by the fact written above.

sen.j: 水戸藩主はそうした色彩の強い立場ではあったため、幕府もこの俗称を半ば黙認し、例えば江戸市中の講談師が徳川光圀を「天下の副将軍」と語っても、何ら取り締まりをしなかったという。
sen.e: Since the lord of Mito Domain was in such an unique status, the bakufu half approved this familiar name, and for example, bakufu didn't crack down on Kodanshi, professional storytellers in Edo called Mitukuni TOKUGAWA "world-famous vice shogun."

Since the lord of Mito Domain was in such an unique status, the bakufu half approved this familiar name, and for example, bakufu didn't crack down on Kodanshi, professional storytellers in Edo called Mitukuni TOKUGAWA "world-famous vice shogun."

Since the lord of Mito Domain was in such an unique status, the bakufu half approved this familiar name, and for example, bakufu didn't crack down on Kodanshi, professional storytellers in Edo called Mitukuni TOKUGAWA "world-famous vice shogun."

sen.j: こうした説は俗説の域を出ないが、当時の水戸藩士はこれを強く信じていたという。
sen.e: These theories are still believed to be common saying, but feudal retainers of Mito Domain at that time strongly believed these stories.
These theories are still believed to be common saying, but feudal retainers of Mito Domain at that time strongly believed these stories.
These theories are still believed to be common saying, but feudal retainers of Mito Domain at that time strongly believed these stories.

sen.j: 水戸徳川家は同じ御三家である尾張徳川家や紀州徳川家のように、将軍家断絶の際の嗣子を輩出することは許されず、官位も権中納言と低く石高も両家に比べ表高で20万石ほど小さかった。
sen.e: Unlike other Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family), the Owari-Tokugawa family and the Kishu-Tokugawa family, the Mito-Tokugawa family was not allowed to produce an heir at the time of extinction of the shogunate family, and official court rank was low status, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), and kokudaka (crop yield) was twenty thousands Goku crop yields smaller than others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Unlike other Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family), the Owari-Tokugawa family and the Kishu-Tokugawa family, the Mito-Tokugawa family was not allowed to produce an heir at the time of extinction of the shogunate family, and official court rank was low status, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), and kokudaka (crop yield) was two hundred thousands Goku crop yields smaller than others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処はOKtwenty thousands →two hundred thousands
sen.e: Unlike other Tokugawa gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family), the Owari-Tokugawa family and the Kishu-Tokugawa family, the Mito-Tokugawa family was not allowed to produce an heir at the time of extinction of the shogunate family, and official court rank was low status, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), and kokudaka (crop yield) was two hundred thousands Goku crop yields smaller than others.

sen.j: その代わり将軍の補佐役として重きをなしたことなどから、もっとも講談師が水戸藩主を天下の副将軍として語った。
sen.e: Instead, as the Mito-Tokugawa family was held in high esteem as the assistant for shogun, Kodanshi, professional storyteller told that the Mito-Tokugawa family was the world famous vice shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 文章が途中で切れていました。原文は、「徳川斉昭が息子の慶喜を将軍職に就けるために意図的に流布させたという説もある」と続いていました。本件は、原文どおり「～語った。」までで訳しました。
sen.e: Instead, as the Mito-Tokugawa family was held in high esteem as the assistant for shogun, Kodanshi, professional storyteller told that the Mito-Tokugawa family was the world famous vice shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処はOK
sen.e: Instead, as the Mito-Tokugawa family was held in high esteem as the assistant for shogun, Kodanshi, professional storyteller told that the Mito-Tokugawa family was the world famous vice shogun.

sen.j: いずれにせよ、当の水戸徳川家の出身である徳川慶喜により大政奉還がなされ、江戸幕府、武家政権そのものが終焉を迎えたことで、副将軍の職及び呼称は完全に消滅したといってよい。
sen.e: At any rate, Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) was done by Yoshinobu Tokugawa from the Mito-Tokugawa family itself, and post and naming of vice shogun was completely abolished with the end of Edo bakufu and samurai government.

At any rate, Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) was done by Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA from the Mito-Tokugawa family itself, and post and naming of vice shogun was completely abolished with the end of Edo bakufu and samurai government.

At any rate, Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) was done by Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA from the Mito-Tokugawa family itself, and post and naming of vice shogun was completely abolished with the end of Edo bakufu and samurai government.

sen.j: 現代における「副将軍」
sen.e: "Vice shogun" today
"Vice shogun" today
"Vice shogun" today

sen.j: 俗説とはいえ御三家の一つ水戸徳川家の当主が「天下の副将軍」などと称されたことを元に、徳川光圀の諸国漫遊の旅を描いた時代劇「水戸黄門」では光圀を「天下の副将軍」「前の副将軍」（水戸藩主の地位を譲って隠居の身であるので）として描いている。
sen.e: In the period drama "Mito Komon" which depicts Mitukuni TOKUGAWA's journey through various districts on the basis of the fact that the head of Mito-Tokugawa family, one of the gosanke, was called "the world famous vice-shogun" although it was common saying., Mitukuni was portrayed as "world famous vice shogun" and "former vice shogun (He resigned his post and is retired)"

In the period drama "Mito Komon", which depicts Mitukuni TOKUGAWA's journey through various districts in the nation on the basis of the fact that the head of Mito-Tokugawa family, one of the gosanke, was called "the world famous vice-shogun" although it was common saying, he was portrayed as "world famous vice shogun" and "former vice shogun" (because he resigned his post and was retired).
sen.cmt: コンマ、ピリオドの位置など修正。Mitsukuni →hebecause 追加
sen.e: In the period drama "Mito Komon", which depicts Mitukuni TOKUGAWA's journey through various districts in the nation on the basis of the fact that the head of Mito-Tokugawa family, one of the gosanke, was called "the world famous vice-shogun" although it was common saying, he was portrayed as "world famous vice shogun" and "former vice shogun" (because he resigned his post and was retired).

sen.j: このドラマの人気が、徳川光圀＝天下の副将軍という認識が定着する要因となっており、正式に副将軍に任ぜられた、或いは江戸幕府の公式な役職として副将軍が設置されていたという誤解を生んでいる。
sen.e: Because of popularity of this drama, understanding of Mitukuni TOKUGAWA = the world famous vice shogun took hold, while this drama also caused the misunderstanding that he was officially appointed as the vice shogun or post of vice shogun was established as the official post in Edo bakufu.

The popularity of this drama has made people identify Mitukuni TOKUGAWA with the world famous vice shogun, causing a misunderstanding that he was officially appointed as the vice shogun or the post of vice shogun was officially established in Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 冒頭部分、＝を使わない表現に修正。
sen.e: The popularity of this drama has made people identify Mitukuni TOKUGAWA with the world famous vice shogun, causing a misunderstanding that he was officially appointed as the vice shogun or the post of vice shogun was officially established in Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 現在、水戸藩の旧領地であった水戸市をはじめとする茨城県内各市町村においては、徳川光圀にちなみ、「副将軍」と称する地酒や産物を販売しており、「水戸の副将軍」という呼称はひとつのブランドとしても用いられている。
sen.e: Today, at each city, town and village in Ibaraki Prefecture including Mito City where was old territorial land of the Mito Domain, jizake (local sake) and local product named "vice shogun" are sold in connection with Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, and the naming "vice shogun in Mito" is used as one of the brand.

Today, at each city, town and village in Ibaraki Prefecture including Mito City where was old territorial land of the Mito Domain, jizake (local sake) and local product named "vice shogun" are sold in connection with Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, and the naming "vice shogun in Mito" is used as one of the brand.

Today, at each city, town and village in Ibaraki Prefecture including Mito City where was old territorial land of the Mito Domain, jizake (local sake) and local product named "vice shogun" are sold in connection with Mitsukuni TOKUGAWA, and the naming "vice shogun in Mito" is used as one of the brand.
